perturbation.original_text: 1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  the  Content  ("Content" as set forth in APPENDIX 2)           owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users  in  the  territory  ("Territory" as set forth in           APPENDIX  2).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  the  Content  ("Content" as generally understood in the industry and determined by plan_b's sole discretion) owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users  in  the  territory  ("Territory" as set forth in           APPENDIX  2).
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Content' is contradicted. Section 1.1 initially refers to Appendix 2 for the definition of Content. However, the modified text suggests that 'Content' is defined by plan_b's discretion, which could include materials not listed in Appendix 2. This creates ambiguity and potential disputes over what constitutes 'Content' under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter           Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the           effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the           terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be           extended  for  an additional period of half a year unless either party           provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of           the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter           Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the           effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the           terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term may be extended at the discretion of plan_b for multiple periods of up to one year each, unless either party           provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of           the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.explanation: Section 7.1 originally stated the 'Initial Term' is automatically extended for half a year unless a party provides a termination notice. The modified version states that it 'may' be extended at the discretion of plan_b for up to one year. This introduces a contradiction because the original text specified an automatic renewal of half a year versus the potential for renewal of upto one year at the discretion of one party. This favors one party, leading to conflicting interpretations on term extensions and disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 3.3  plan_b  shall  provide  LICENSOR  with  a  detailed  written  record,           which  includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution           channel.  Such  report  shall  be  provided  to LICENSOR in electronic           format  within  6  weeks  of  the  end  of  a  quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3  plan_b  shall  endeavor to provide LICENSOR  with  a  written  record,           which  may include an estimate of  the number of End User downloads and distribution           channels, subject to resource availability.  Such  report shall be provided to LICENSOR when feasible.
perturbation.explanation: Section 3.3 originally mandates plan_b to provide a detailed written record within 6 weeks of each quarter's end. The changed version introduces ambiguity by changing 'shall' to 'shall endeavor' and stating that reports 'may include' estimates depending on 'resource availability' and are submitted 'when feasible.' This creates a contradiction if other sections of the contract depend on accurate quarterly reports because this is not guranteed by the modified section.
